answers.answer: my OB thought I was high risk for GD and had me do the test at 13 weeks. I passed. I know I'll have to do it again around 27 weeks. YEAH, I just *love* drinking that orange ****
I just did mine the other day.  I am 27 weeks.
For most cases it it is around 28 weeks, unless they have reasons for doing it earlier, such as a history of Diabetes.

I heard it was like your 24th week that you get tested.  I mentioned it to the nurse because my dad was just diagnosed with diabetes but she said I was fine and that I will have to wait until my 24th week.Songbird: Why, if you dont mind be asking, did they consider you high risk?  Was it because of a family member(s) having it or beacuse you've had gd before?
They did mine at 22 weeks but I was having some issues that caused them to think i might have it.... They said i was fine and said it would be the only time they tested me unless something came up

Diabeties runs in my family....my dad and his mom both have type 2. My 1st 2 babies were big (DD on time at 9lbs, DS 3 1/2 weeks early at 8 1/2 lbs), and since I'm overwieght, they just thought I might have it. I proved them wrong though, I haven't had it yet

Well see, that's why I thought I should get tested early.  My dad and grandmother have it.  My mom doesnt.  I'm overweight by I'm not sure how much but when I got prego I was 157 at 5'3, I'm 168 now.  But my weight has fluctuated up to 230 when I was a teen due to Steroids (asthma)and not being able to be to active due to asthma. But i've remained on the smaller side (smaller compared to before anyhow) for most of my adult life (i'm 26). What do you think?  Think I should bring it up to the dr next visit? Thanks
I'm having mine next Thursday... I'll be 28 weeks
I got mine at 24 or 26 weeks, don't remember exactly but it was definitely around the end of second trimester.

sorry for not posting earlier. The baby and I took a nap since we're both sick. My MIL took my 3yr old out shopping. It was sooo nice.well, I didn't have a choice. When they realized my 'risks' they said I will be having it early. I knew I don't have it. Actually, it's a bit on the low side while I'm pg. I have to eat/drink something every 2 hours to keep from getting dizzy or sick.I wouldn't worry too much about it. Getting tested when you're 28 weeks should be ok. Or you can ask to be tested at 24/25 weeks. That's what we did with my 1st because I was feeling sick all the time

question: How far along were you when your Dr. ordered your 1 hour glucose test.  I am 17 weeks and I know I still have a few weeks before that happens, but I don't remember how far along you do it.  I am trying to figure out my vacation days and how many I need to save.  Thanks
title: How far along before you had 1hour glucose test?  Open Fourm
